tool.name: shrinkwrapFeats

param.name: in_Feats
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class containing features to be aggregated

param.name: dil_Dist
param.dialogReference: Dilation distance used to aggregate features. This must be a positive value. If any features are within twice this distance of each other, they will be combined into a single output feature.

param.name: smthMulti
param.dialogReference:
Smoothing multiplier. This is the amount by which the dilation distance is multiplied for use in the final smoothing operation. It must be a positive value.

  • The value of 8 seems to work well for ConSite delineation, but the user can specify a different value if desired.

  • Larger values will generate smoother, more generalized features.

  • Smaller values will tend to generate features with "scalloped" edges.

param.name: scratch_GDB
param.dialogReference:
Scratch geodatabase specified to store temporary/intermediate data.

If not specified, intermediate data will be stored in memory and will not persist; this is preferred for faster processing. It is recommended that you only specify a scratch geodatabase if you need to trouble-shoot poor automation results, or if your computer has insufficient memory for processing large datasets.

tool.summary: Aggregates features depending on the specified dilation distance, outputting smooth shapes fully encompassing the input shapes. This is a subroutine used for delineation of Natural Heritage Conservation Sites, but may be useful for other applications as well.

dataIdInfo.idAbs: Aggregates features depending on the specified dilation distance, outputting smooth shapes fully encompassing the input shapes. This is a subroutine used for delineation of Natural Heritage Conservation Sites, but may be useful for other applications as well.
